conclusion: Shadows are created by objects blocking light, and their direction and length depend on the angle and direction of the light rays.
When the light source moves forward, the light rays approach the objects from a more direct angle, causing changes in the shadows' position and size.
Shadow A will move slightly backward, away from the cake.
Shadow B will move slightly backward, away from the yellow folder.
Shadow C will move slightly backward, away from the blue juice box.
Shadow D will move slightly backward, away from the baseball.
Shadow A will become slightly shorter as the light source moves closer in the horizontal plane.
Shadow B will become slightly shorter.
Shadow C will become slightly shorter.
Shadow D will become slightly shorter.
As the light source moves forward, the shadows of all objects will shift backward and become slightly shorter due to the change in the angle of the light rays.
The shadows A, B, C, and D will all move backward (away from the objects) and become slightly shorter.
